com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler<BusinessObjectClass extends java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler<BusinessObjectClass>
  • Enclosing class:
    AppPublics

    public static final class AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler<BusinessObjectClass extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper which receives multi-selection intents with an action set to SELECTION_ACTION, and which remembers and triggers event according to the current selection.

    The BusinessObjectClass "template" class must implement properly the Object.equals(Object) method, in order to ensure the unicity of business objects inside the selected business objects.

    Since:
    2010.06.21

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler.OnMultiSelectionChanged<BusinessObjectClass>
      The interface which is invoked by the AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler when a new selection event occurs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_SELECTED
      Used as a key in the intent bundle, so as to indicate whether the event deals with a selection or deselection.
      static java.lang.String SELECTION_ACTION
      Use this intent action when you need to indicate to the current activity that a business object has been selected or unselected.

    • Field Detail

      • SELECTION_ACTION

        public static java.lang.String SELECTION_ACTION
        Use this intent action when you need to indicate to the current activity that a business object has been selected or unselected.
        See Also:
        the {@link MultiSelectionHandler#EXTRA_SELECTED} and {@link MultiSelectionHandler#EXTRA_BUSINESS_OBJECT} extra flags for indicated whether the business object is selected, and what business object this is about

      • EXTRA_SELECTED

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_SELECTED
        Used as a key in the intent bundle, so as to indicate whether the event deals with a selection or deselection.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSelectedCount

        public final int getSelectedCount()
        Returns:
        the number of business objects currently selected

      • getSelectedObjects

        public final java.util.List<BusinessObjectClass> getSelectedObjects()
        Returns:
        the currently selected business objects. Do not modify the returned list!

      • clearSelection

        public final void clearSelection()
        Clears the selected objects.

      • onSelection

        public boolean onSelection(android.content.Intent intent,
                  AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler.OnMultiSelectionChanged onMultiSelectionChanged)
        The method to invoke when the activity receives a intent, due to as business object selection/unselection.

        Usually invoked from the BroadcastReceiver which is listening to business objects selection events}.

        Parameters:
        intent - the received intent; if the action of the Intent is not the right one, no processing is done
        onMultiSelectionChanged - the interface that will be callbacked (in the same thread as the calling method) depending on the overall multi-selection state; is allowed to be null
        Returns:
        true if the intent has been handled ; false otherwise

      • setSelection

        public void setSelection(BusinessObjectClass businessObject,
                boolean selected)
        Sets the selection state for a given business object.

        However, the call does not trigger the AppPublics.MultiSelectionHandler.OnMultiSelectionChanged.onSelectionChanged(boolean, boolean, List) callback.

        Parameters:
        businessObject - the business object related to that selection event
        selected - whether the business object should be considered as selected
